sentences.en: In life, everybody has their moments of glory although they may go unnoticed like the accompanist. This does not mean, however, that they are any less important than anyone else.
sentences.cn: 在生活中，每个人都有着自己光辉的瞬间，虽然他们可能会与伴奏者一样不被人注目，但是，这并不意味着他们的重要程度会比其他人低。

sentences.en: In the reverse case, when the soloist has fully mastered tempo, technique and musical expression, it is conceivable that an accompanist able to put in a level of only 80% might suffice.
sentences.cn: 相反的情况，当独奏者已经完全掌握了速度，技巧和音乐性的表达，可以想象伴奏者能够发挥80％的水平就足够了。

sentences.en: In the white board world, YAKUDO will always be your accompanist!
sentences.cn: 在白板的世界里, 雅谷与您同行!

sentences.en: Of course, the accompanist has to respond to the different expressiveness of the chords in supporting the melody.
sentences.cn: 当然，伴奏者必须对那些为旋律所配和弦的不同“表情”做出反应。

sentences.en: The man is a piano accompanist.

words.tran_cn: 陪伴，伴随；伴奏（accompany的过去分词）

trans.tran_en: someone who plays a musical instrument while another person sings or plays the main tune
